definition: few/less/to lack/to be missing/to stop (doing sth)/seldom

sentences.english: What vitamin or what is that split to lack on the side of fingernail?
sentences.chinese: 手指甲旁邊那塊裂開了是缺少什麼維生素還是什麼啊？

sentences.english: Without film history , film critique has no difference with well no source.
sentences.chinese: 缺少電影史，電影批評仿若無源之泉。

sentences.english: Something that seems in short supply in their over-scheduled lives.
sentences.chinese: 這些似乎就是他們所缺少的在日程過滿的生活中。

sentences.english: Street-lamp lighting system is an essential part of public facility for city construction.
sentences.chinese: 路燈照明系統是城市建設不可缺少的公用設施。

sentences.english: A lack of sleep can interfere with your ability to assimilate new information.
sentences.chinese: 缺少睡眠能夠影響你吸收新信息的能力。

sentences.english: An integral part of any roof is its flashing.
sentences.chinese: 遮雨板是任何屋面中不可缺少的一部分。

sentences.english: NS2 ( Network Simulator Version2) as open source software, it lacks the ability to simulate some latest developed algorithms.
sentences.chinese: NS2作爲開源軟件缺少對最新研究算法的模擬能力。

sentences.english: Surface editing is indispensable in point-based data treatment.
sentences.chinese: 曲面編輯是點雲處理不可缺少的研究內容。

sentences.english: Punctuation marks are an integrant sign of cohesion and coherence in modern writing.
sentences.chinese: 標點符號是現代書面語中不可缺少的銜接和連貫標誌。

sentences.english: I am grouchy due to lack of recent physical intimacy.
sentences.chinese: 我因爲最近缺少肌膚之親，所以心情不好。

sentences.english: No special handing for a missing end of line marker at the end of the file is provided.
sentences.chinese: 對於檔結尾缺少的行尾標記，不提供特殊的處理。

sentences.english: Fu, not overcharging, poor does not fill the lack of a policy fairness.
sentences.chinese: 不能富時多收了，窮時並不補，缺少了政策的公平性。

sentences.english: If lack of sex is going to disintegrate you, then go out and have a love-affair.
sentences.chinese: 如果缺少性的滿足使你不完備，那麼找一個對手去。

sentences.english: The problem was humanistic psychology is said lacked the rigorous methodology.
sentences.chinese: 人本主義心理學缺少嚴謹的方法論。

sentences.english: I am always unconfident , and lack other's affirm, and can't see the future.
sentences.chinese: 我現在是不自信，缺少別人的認可，永遠看不到希望。

sentences.english: He was baffled by their lack of enthusiam .
sentences.chinese: 他對他們缺少激情的狀態感到很迷惑。

definition: to be deficient in sth/to be short of sth (supplies, money etc)
haven't/hasn't/doesn't exist/to not have/to not be
and/as well as/and so/but (not)/yet (not)/(indicates causal relation)/(indicates change of state)/(indicates contrast)
of/~'s (possessive particle)/(used after an attribute)/(used to form a nominal expression)/(used at the end of a declarative sentence for emphasis)
